business.headline: Sensex closes 64 points higher, Nifty above 25,200; SBI gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 63.57 points to end at 82.634.48, while the NSE Nifty50 gained just 16.25 points to close at 25,212.05.

Gurugram's luxury flats, flooded streets: Is real estate bubble about to burst?Gurugram's luxury real estate may be booming, but repeated rain-induced flooding is testing its long-term value. If basic infrastructure fails, even the city's glitziest addresses could lose their appeal.

Is gold losing its shine? Here's why fewer people are investing in the yellow metalEarlier, gold symbolised family pride and social standing, but today's youngsters often see gold jewellery as outdated and instead put their money into things they believe will grow faster than gold ever could.

Fewer slabs, simpler rules? Next GST Council meet may trigger overhaulThe upcoming GST Council meeting, likely to be held in August 2025 after the monsoon session of Parliament, could bring key reforms in the way GST is structured and collected.

Housing sales slide 14% as affordability pressures mount across cities: ReportThe PropTiger report, which tracks sales and launches across major cities, found that the most significant annual drop was recorded in Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) and Pune, where sales fell by 32% and 27% respectively.

Why this IITian took up a guard's job to build Mygate, valued at Rs 1,600 croreMyGate has raised a total of $83.3 million across eight rounds. Its latest funding was in April 2023, a Series B round worth $3.29 million, putting its valuation at Rs 1,670 crore, according to Tracxn.

Tesla is finally in India. But can it go the distance?Tesla's India debut is a big milestone, but long-term success will depend on how well the company adapts to India's unique mix of pricing realities, policy expectations, and market dynamics.

Are private school fees draining India's middle class? CA shares eye-opening figuresWith fees climbing each year, parents are feeling the pinch more than ever. Maybe now is the right moment to pause, think, and ask ourselves, are we getting real value for this cost? Can we secure our kids' future without spending a fortune on fees? asks a Delhi-based CA.

SSY scheme: How your daughter can get Rs 71 lakh at 21It is a small savings scheme backed by the government, which offers high interest rates, tax benefits under Section 80C, and tax-free returns on maturity. Over 4.1 crore accounts have been opened so far under this scheme.

Good news soon for HDFC Bank shareholders? Here's all you need to knowHDFC Bank shares have delivered a 24% gain over the past year, with a year-to-date rise of nearly 13%. The stock has climbed more than 21% over the last six months, posting gains of 7% over the past three months and 4% in the previous month.

Did Ashok Leyland shares fall over 50% today? Details hereThe steep drop is the result of the company's 1:1 bonus issue, which came into effect on Wednesday. When a stock goes "ex-bonus," its price adjusts to reflect the additional shares being issued.
Sensex opens 69 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; HDFC Bank up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 197.64 points to 82,373.27, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 61.80 points to 25,134.00 as of 9:28 am.

Anthem Biosciences IPO to close for bidding: Check latest subscription, GMPThis IPO is entirely an offer for sale (OFS) of 5.96 crore equity shares by existing shareholders. The company itself will not receive any money from this offer. The price band has been set at Rs 570 per share.

Big GST changes ahead? Centre signals green light, says reportThe Prime Minister's Office (PMO) has given an in-principle nod to a revamp of the GST structure, paving the way for possible reforms in the upcoming GST Council meeting scheduled for August.

The Theobroma story: How 2 sisters turned a cafe into 225-store pan-India chainPrivate equity firm ChrysCapital has struck a sweet deal to acquire a 90% stake in Theobroma Foods for Rs 2,410 crore. The bakery chain, started by two sisters in Mumbai, has grown into a 225-store brand loved for its brownies and cakes. Read on to know more about the Mumbai-based bakery chain.

MTNL misses Rs 8,585 crore payments, owes 7 public sector banksIn a filing on Tuesday, MTNL confirmed that it has defaulted on both principal and interest payments to a group of lenders, which include some of India's biggest state-owned banks.
Sensex ends 317 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; HCLTech down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 317.45 points to end at 82,570.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 113.50 points to close at 25,195.80.

Anthem Biosciences IPO fully booked: Should you subscribe? Check listing gainsThe IPO opened for subscription on July 14, aims to raise Rs 3,395 crore through a complete offer for sale (OFS) of 5.96 crore equity shares.

Why Rs 12 crore didn't make this man happy? Investment advisor explainsWhile money matters, it should never cost you your health, peace of mind, or precious family time. True wealth is living well, not just stacking numbers in a bank account, says an investment advisor.

Why Zerodha's Nithin Kamath wants short selling made easy in IndiaIf someone wants to short a stock today, they mostly do it through futures or options. But there's a catch, there are only 224 stocks in India that have futures and options. So if a bad company is not on that list, no one can short it easily.

Theobroma to be sold, Rs 2,410-crore sweet deal baked by ChrysCapital: ReportFounded in 2004 by sisters Kainaz Messman Harchandrai and Tina Messman Wykes, Theobroma began with a single outlet at Cusrow Baug on Mumbai's Colaba Causeway.

Claiming fake ITR refunds? Here's what could happenTo give honest taxpayers a chance to fix their mistakes, the department had earlier asked people to revise their returns if they had claimed any wrong deductions.

Filing ITR-2 or ITR-3? Check these common mistakes and tips to avoid themUsing the Excel utility for ITR-2 or ITR-3 seems easy, but it's easy to get stuck if you're not careful. One wrong entry can throw your entire tax calculation off. Here's a handy guide to avoid common slip-ups.

Explained: Why HCLTech shares are down 4% todayOver the past few days, HCLTech has been under pressure. The stock has declined 7.9% in the last five trading sessions, 9.58% in the past month, and over 14.6% in the past six months.

Tesla showroom now in Mumbai. Price list of Model Y EVs in India revealed  Live UpdatesThe Mumbai showroom will serve as Tesla's main display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.
Sensex opens 119 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Tata Motors up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 176.33 points to 82,429.79, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.50 points to 25,145.80 as of 9:29 am.

Tesla's Model Y to debut in India at Rs 60 lakhIn comparison, the Model Y starts at $44,990 in the United States, 263,500 yuan in China, and 45,970 euros in Germany. This makes the Indian version one of the most expensive, mainly due to import duties and logistics costs.

Sensex, Nifty today: Inflation drops, but will stock markets rise?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,166 points around 8:22 am, suggesting a possible higher start for Nifty50, which closed at 25,082.3 on Monday. This points to cautious optimism on Dalal Street after four straight sessions of losses.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO allotment: Online guide to see status. Check GMPInvestors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (also known as Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Bitcoin hits record $123,000 as US policy hopes boost crypto marketBitcoin is up about 30% so far this year and its rise has lifted other coins too. Ether, the second-biggest token, climbed to a five-month high of $3,059. XRP and Solana also rose about 3% each.

Retail inflation cools to 6-year low of 2.10% in JuneThis is the fifth month in a row that inflation has remained below the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) medium-term target of 4%, and the eighth consecutive month it has stayed under the central bank's upper limit of 6%
Sensex closes 247 points lower, Nifty below 25,100; Eternal up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 247.01 points to close at 82,253.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 67.55 points to end at 25,082.30.

Trap, click, renew: How OTT apps make it hard to cancel subscriptionsAccording to data collected by community platform LocalCircles, 50% of respondents said they have frequently had difficulty cancelling subscriptions to digital services.

Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta on why your portfolio should be yours, not someone else'sBuilding your investment portfolio should match your own risk comfort, timeframe and goals. What works for your friend may not work for you, says MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, Radhika Gupta.

Why your tax refund may be delayed this yearOne big reason for the delay is that the tax filing season began late this year. Normally, people can file their returns from April onwards. But this time, the Income Tax Department released the ITR utilities quite late.
Sensex down 400 points: Why is stock market falling todayAs of 11:50 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down by 388.85 points to 82,111.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 110.85 points to 25,039.00.

Only 6.7% filed ITRs: CoinSwitch co-founder on why Indians delay tax filingIndia has made big progress in digital tax filing over the years. There are new portals, better forms and more ways to pay taxes online. Yet, millions still wait till the last few days to get their documents in order.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares gained 5% todayOla Electric share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 43.60 before trading 5.45% higher at Rs 41.99 around 11:11 am, shortly after the electric two-wheeler maker announced its financial results for the first quarter of FY26.

Bitcoin zooms past $120,000 to reach all-time high. Here's whyThe world's largest cryptocurrency was last seen trading at $120,700.54, up 1.32%, as investor confidence remained strong ahead of important regulatory discussions in the United States.
Sensex, Nifty start week in red as IT stocks drag markets lower againThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 266.34 points to 82,234.13, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 67.95 points to 25,081.90 as of 9:22 am.

entertainment.headline: Supergirl first look: Milly Alcock stars in DC's gritty new filmJames Gunn unveiled the first poster for Supergirl starring Milly Alcock. The film, set for 2026, explores a darker, grittier origin story, expanding DC Studios' rebooted universe with fresh emotional depth.

Disney sues Hong Kong jewellery firm over Mickey Mouse trademarkDisney has sued Hong Kong's Red Earth Group, accusing it of trademark infringement for using Mickey Mouse imagery in its jewellery line. The entertainment giant seeks a court injunction and damages.

Harry Potter stars Emma Watson, Zoe Wanamaker banned from driving for speedingEmma Watson and Zoe Wanamaker, both Harry Potter stars, have been banned from driving for six months and fined £1,044 each after separate speeding offences and prior penalty points.

Tomorrowland Main stage destroyed by fire days before festival beginsA major fire destroyed Tomorrowland's main stage just days before the festival. While no injuries were reported, organisers face pressure to announce its fate amid fake cancellation emails and global anticipation.

American Idol music head Robin Kaye and husband found shot dead at LA homePolice found American Idol music supervisor Robin Kaye and her husband dead at their LA home. A 22-year-old local man has been arrested in the suspected double homicide.

Stranger Things 5 teaser: Vecna returns to Hawkins and stakes have never been higherNetflix revealed the much-awaited teaser for 'Stranger Things' final season. The release of the finale is planned in two phases, starting November 2025.

Ronit Roy to replace Sudhanshu Pandey in Anupamaa: ReportActor Ronit Roy is reportedly set to join popular television show 'Anupamaa'. He could be seen taking over as Vanraj Shah after actor Sudhanshu Pandey's exit. This casting aims to boost the show's ratings following recent challenges.

Rajinikanth's Coolie plot leaked online? Here's what we knowThe plot of actor Rajinikanth's much-anticipated film 'Coolie' has reportedly been leaked online, despite the makers keeping key details tightly under wraps. The film is slated for a theatrical release on August 14.

Singer Kailash Kher reacts to shooting at Kapil Sharma's Canada cafeSinger Kailash Kher reacted to the incident involving an open fire at Kapil Sharma's restaurant in Canada. The shooting occurred on July 10.

Shaan on quitting Sa Re Ga Ma Pa against Himesh's advice, boosting Aditya's fameSinger Shaan revealed that he had to leave 'Sa Re Ga Ma Pa' as a gesture towards his producer-friend. The producer who had appointed him departed from ZeeTV, following internal disputes.

Rajinikanth's classic Baashha to re-release in theatres ahead of CoolieAs Rajinikanth's fans gear up for 'Coolie', his iconic 1995 gangster drama 'Baashha' is set to return to theatres in a newly restored 4K version with Dolby Atmos, marking the film's 30th anniversary.

Kalki 2898 AD bags Best Film nomination alongside Stree 2, Empuraan at IFFM 2025Nag Ashwin's 'Kalki 2898 AD' continues its global run with a Best Film nomination at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2025. The nomination came a year after its release, with recognition pouring in for the film's vision and scale.

Taylor Swift's father undergoes heart surgery, family gives health updatePop sensation Taylor Swift's father, Scott Swift, is on the road to recovery following a successful quintuple bypass surgery. The global music icon was reportedly by his side throughout the ordeal.

Salman Khan melts hearts as he hugs young fan at Mumbai eventSalman Khan charmed everyone by warmly embracing a young fan on stage during an event in Mumbai. The video quickly grabbed a lot of attention.

Is The Revolutionaries Rohit Saraf's bold move to break the soft-boy mold?Actor Rohit Saraf steps away from his romantic image in the upcoming series, 'The Revolutionaries'. His role of a freedom fighter could mark his most serious and defining performance yet. If done right, this could be his chance to pivot from the chocolate boy image.

The Summer I Turned Pretty 3 Review: A dull ride through a cringe summer rom-comRelease Date:Wed Jul 16, 2025The Summer I Turned Pretty Season 3 series review: The Prime Video series returned with familiar teen romance and recycled drama, leaving viewers craving freshness in the teen rom-com genre. Despite strong music and a good-looking cast, the show struggles with pacing and emotional depth, making it feel like a repetitive rerun.

Dating or just dropping content? Ashish Chanchlani, Elli's video has fans guessingInfluencer Ashish Chanchlani teamed up with actor Elli AvrRam for a fun video on Wednesday. The video, which was shared on Instagram, sparked further interest in their relationship.

Rahul Raj Singh demands evidence from Kamya Punjabi in Pratyusha Banerjee death caseRahul Raj Singh challenges Kamya Punjabi and Neeru Shah to provide evidence or face legal consequences. He claims their actions had severely impacted his life after Pratyusha Banerjee's death.

Priyanka, Kareena, Varun and others wish Katrina Kaif on her 42nd birthdayActors Priyanka Chopra, Kareena Kapoor and Varun Dhawan, among others, extended birthday wishes to Katrina Kaif on social media. The 'Merry Christmas' actor turned 42 years old on Wednesday.

general news.headline: Trump says US 'very close' to trade deal with India, negotiations underwayUS President Donald Trump said the US is "very close" to a trade deal with India, aiming for greater market access and lower tariffs through ongoing negotiations influenced by his tariff strategy.

Air India finds no fault in fuel control switches on Boeing 787 planes: OfficialAir India has completed inspections of fuel control switches in its Boeing 787 fleet and found no faults, following DGCA's directive after a deadly crash last month. The AAIB report had flagged the role of fuel switches in the engine shutdown.

Khamenei warns of 'even bigger blow' to US and Israel if attacked againKhamenei pointed to Iran's strike on US' air bases in Qatar, calling it only the start of what Tehran is capable of. He warned that Iran could deal an even stronger blow to the US and its allies.

Magnitude 7.3 earthquake strikes Alaska Peninsula, tsunami warning issuedFollowing the tremor, the US Tsunami Warning System issued a tsunami warning for parts of coastal Alaska. Authorities have urged residents in affected areas to stay alert and follow safety instructions.

Shubhanshu Shukla's emotional reunion with family after space mission. See picsShukla was greeted by his family at a designated facility in Houston, where initial medical checks were conducted before the reunion.

Video: Israel rains bombs on Syria; blast near presidential palace, civilians hitIsrael launched major airstrikes on Syrian military headquarters in Damascus, citing the need to protect Druze civilians in Sweida. The strikes followed weeks of violence by Syrian forces against minorities near the Israeli border.

Join us after 2029 if you want: Devendra Fadnavis' offer to Uddhav ThackerayThe remark came during the farewell ceremony of Ambadas Danve, the Leader of Opposition and a member of Thackeray's faction of the Shiv Sena.

Why Bangladesh razing Satyajit Ray's ancestral home is a shared cultural lossThe Ray family has been one of the architects of the Bengali experience, their works foundational to the artistic and educational landscape on both sides of the border

Video: Anchor runs for cover live on air as Israel launches airstrikes on SyriaThe video clip shared by Israeli Defence Minister, Israel Katz on X, showed the anchor reading news about the latest strikes by the Jewish nation on Syria.
SSVM Institutions: From Cradle to CosmosForging Futures with Foresight, Flair, and Faith

Delhi-Goa IndiGo flight makes emergency landing in Mumbai over engine failureThe aircraft landed at 9.42 pm at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport. The pilot had raised an alarm at 9.25 pm and landed the plane safely.

Facts from known sources, aim is holistic learning: NCERT on Mughal chapter rowNCERT has released an official statement on its new Class 8 textbook 'Exploring Society, India and Beyond'. Responding to criticism around chapters on the Mughal era, it said that all of its content is fact-based and aimed at holistic learning.

Happy World Snake Day, dear relativesSnakes are a misunderstood and feared lot, though 75% of them found in India are non-venomous. On World Snake Day, paying tribute to a species that's more venomous and strikes without provocation, our relatives.

Narayana Murthy's in-flight 'masterclass' with Tejasvi Surya ft 70-hour week, PMSharing details of their conversation on a Mumbai-Bengaluru flight, which Tejasvi Surya described as a 'two-hour masterclass', the BJP MP said it featured topics ranging from AI to a 70-hour work week.

Why no cameras in cockpits? Air India crash sparks debate, demandThe fuel-switch report in the Air India Boeing 787 crash probe has sparked a demand for a cockpit video recorder. The NTSB of the US that probes air crashes has for years batted for one. If cockpit voice recorders are part of the black boxes of planes, what has kept cockpit video recorders, which would aid air crash investigations, from being installed?

How Mamata's rallying cry for Bangla-speaking migrant workers is echoing till Delhi"I've decided to speak more in Bangla from now on—arrest me if you can," charged the Bengal chief minister after her party's Kolkata rally

Stranger Things 5 teaser: Vecna returns to Hawkins and stakes have never been higherNetflix revealed the much-awaited teaser for 'Stranger Things' final season. The release of the finale is planned in two phases, starting November 2025.

Did secret agent Melania Trumpenko turn Trump against Putin?Is US First Lady Melania Trump a secret agent who turned Donald Trump against Russian President Vladimir Putin? Yes, if social media is to be believed. Melania became a hero for Ukrainians and became the subject of "Agent Melania Trumpenko" memes after Trump credited her with questioning Putin's actions.

Woman gangraped by 7 men in moving car, held captive for 11 days in RajasthanAccording to the complaint filed by the survivor's husband, the incident began on the night of April 25, when the woman went outside her home to relieve herself. She was allegedly forced into a Bolero vehicle by three men.

Highly unlikely: Trump denies plans to fire Fed Chair Jerome PowellPresident Trump dismissed reports he plans to fire Fed Chair Jerome Powell but admitted discussing it with GOP lawmakers. He called it unlikely, unless there's fraud, amid ongoing criticism of Powell.

Rare sitting Gandhi portrait sold in London for Rs 1.75 cr, double the estimateA rare oil portrait of Mahatma Gandhi, painted by British artist Clare Leighton in 1931 during the Indian leader's London visit for the second Round Table Conference, sold for GBP 152,800 (Rs 1.75 crore). The oil portrait, believed to be the only one which Gandhi personally sat for, was auctioned at more than double its estimated price.

Top court glass partition installed, removed in months. Total cost: Rs 2.68 croreThrough the RTI filed by India Today, we have exclusively learnt that the total cost of installation of the glass panels in the Supreme Court amounted to approximately Rs 2.6 crore. The cost of its removal was estimated at Rs 8,63,700.
How India went the 'extra' mile in Lord's Test defeatThe margin of loss against England wasn't really 22 runs, but the 63 extras that Team India conceded in the match

Indian Army soldier arrested from Jammu and Kashmir in Pak-linked espionage caseDevinder Singh was produced in a Mohali court on July 15, which granted a six-day police remand for further questioning.

sports.headline: Russell to retire from international cricket after 1st two T20Is vs AustraliaWest Indies all-rounder Andre Russell is all set to retire from international cricket after the first two T20Is against Australia. The first two matches of the series will take place on July 20 and 22.

Embarrassing running: Harleen Deol faces flak for bizarre run outENG-W vs IND-W: Harleen Deol fell to a direct hit from Alice Davidson-Richards in the first ODI in Southampton, after which the Indian batter was greeted with criticism.

No long-term goals, just stay injury-free ahead of World Championships: SatwiksairajSatwiksairaj Rankireddy said that he and Chirag Shetty aren't keeping any long-term goals in mind and are focused on remaining fit for next month's World Championships.

Bangladesh secure historic T20I series win vs Sri Lanka after Tanzid, Mahedi fireSL vs BAN: Litton Das' Bangladesh claimed the T20I series 2-1 after winning the decider against Sri Lanka on Wednesday by eight wickets at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

SA vs NZ: Robinson, Duffy star as New Zealand begin Rob Walter era with winTim Robinson and Jacob Duffy were the stars of the show as New Zealand started the Rob Walter era with a win in the second match of the tri-series on Friday, July 16 in Harare.

Mahedi Hasan breaks Harbhajan Singh's 13-year-old record in Colombo T20ISL vs BAN: Mahedi Hasan finished with figures of 4-1-11-4 in the third and final game of the three-match series against Sri Lanka on Wednesday, July 16 at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

World's best bowler Jasprit Bumrah has to play Manchester Test: Ex-India cricketerFormer India wicketkeeper Deep Dasgupta wants Jasprit Bumrah to play the Manchester Test against England as he feels that the match is crucial in the context of the series. Bumrah is tipped to play just three Tests during the series.

Panicked during Ben Stokes's long Lord's spells, but great sign for us: Joe RootJoe Root said that he panicked a bit when Ben Stokes was bowling his long spells during the Lord's Test but feels that it is a good sign for England moving forward. Stokes was the star of the show with the ball as they won the third Test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
